intro: Nassauvia pyramidalis var. arachnodea, commonly known as the featherleaf nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens or as a border plant. The variety arachnodea is distinguished by its finely divided leaves, which give it a lacy appearance.
